content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    current_line = ""
    wrapped_text = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped_text *= (current_line * "\n")
            current_line = word
        else
            if !isempty(current_line)
                current_line *= " "
            end
            current_line *= word
        end
    end
    
    wrapped_text *= current_line  # Add the last line
    return wrapped_text
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "Julia is a high-level, high-performance, dynamic programming language."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This will result in a string where each line is at most `text_width` characters long, broken at spaces between words.
